metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2327 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
PCRE before 8.36 mishandles the /(((a\2)|(a*)\g<-1>))*/ pattern and relatedpatterns with certain internal recursive back references, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted regular expression, asdemonstrated by a JavaScript RegExp object encountered by Konqueror.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2327` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1').
